message.content:
cs.IT, cs.CC, cs.DS, cs.SI, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with the problem of variable-length source coding allowing errors, which is a topic in information theory (cs.IT). The analysis of the exponential moment of the codeword length involves techniques from coding theory (cs.CC) and probability theory (cs.PR). The smooth Renyi entropy is a concept from information theory and cryptography (cs.IT, cs.CR), and its use in characterizing the optimal exponential moment of the codeword length is a novel contribution. The paper also involves some computational experiments (cs.DS) and optimization techniques (cs.LG) to obtain numerical results and verify the theoretical findings.
